item.title: Danielle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "When it is dark enough, you can see the stars." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Danielle add a quote by A.A. Milne
Danielle add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Happiness is a warm puppy." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
Danielle add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So he tasted the deep pain that is reserved only for the strong, just as he had tasted for a little while the deep happiness." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Tobias Wolff
item.description: "We are made to persist. that's how we find out who we are." -- Tobias Wolff

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description:
"Alice laughed. 'There's no use trying,' she said. 'One can't believe impossible things.'
I daresay you haven't had much practice,' said the Queen. 'When I was your age, I always did it for half-an-hour a day. Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast. There goes the shawl again!" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "I'm not so sure he's mad, Father. Just a little devious in his sanity." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Kate Elliott
item.description: "Luck is only my lover, not my wife," replied Bahktiaan easily. He drew his saber. "If ever I wed, it will be skill and intelligence." <BR>"Tedious bedfellows," said Sergi." -- Kate Elliott

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Elizabeth Stone
item.description: "Making the decision to have a child - it is momentous. It is to decide forever to have your heart go walking around outside your body. " -- Elizabeth Stone

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "The moon is always jealous of the heat of the day, just as the sun always longs for something dark and deep." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Danielle add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "This is the true joy in life, the being used for a purpose recognized by yourself as a mighty one; the being thoroughly worn out before you are thrown on the scrap heap; the being a force of Nature instead of a feverish selfish little clod of ailments and grievances complaining that the world will not devote itself to making you happy." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Empedocles
item.description: "Many fires burn below the surface." -- Empedocles

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Kate Elliot
item.description: "They say that your eyes contain fire, that your face fills with light." -- Kate Elliot

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Kate Elliott
item.description: "When you have a full and eager heart in you, you must not go to a man whose heart is empty and weak." -- Kate Elliott

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "I hate quotations. Tell me what you know." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Mark Jenkins
item.description: "Maps encourage boldness. They're like cryptic love letters. They make anything seem possible." -- Mark Jenkins

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Alfred Tennyson
item.description: "In the afternoon they came unto a land In which it seemed always afternoon. All around the coast the languid air did swoon, Breathing like one that hath a weary dream." -- Alfred Tennyson

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Percy Shelley
item.description: "The cloud of mind is discharging its collected lightning." -- Percy Shelley

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Michael Thomas, "Man Gone Down"
item.description: "I wonder if this is what it feels like, falling out of love: feeling yourself fading out of existence - the gray sky, the coffee shop limbo - everything a way station of sorts. Making promises you know you can't keep. Making promises - period. People in love shouldn't have to vow or demand, petition or exhort. Nothing. Not even question. No collisions with your surroundings or yourself - you move gently, unknowing, in time." -- Michael Thomas, "Man Gone Down"

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Danielle add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description:
"I carry your heart with me (I carry it in my heart)I am never without it (anywhere I go you go,my dear; and whatever is done by only me is your doing,my darling) I fear no fate (for you are my fate,my sweet)I want no world (for beautiful you are my world,my true) and it's you are whatever a moon has always meant and whatever a sun will always sing is you
here is the deepest secret nobody knows (here is the root of the root and the bud of the bud and the sky of the sky of a tree called life; which grows higher than the soul can hope or mind can hide) and this is the wonder that's keeping the stars apart
I carry your heart (I carry it in my heart)" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Isak Dinesen
Danielle add a quote by Lauren Kessler, "Dancing with Rose"
item.description: "I am losing my mind," she says, looks down for a moment, then back up at the camera. "But the essence of a person is their heart, isn't it?" -- Lauren Kessler, "Dancing with Rose"

item.title: Danielle add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "That is part of the beauty of all literature. You discover that your longings are universal longings, that you're not lonely and isolated from anyone. You belong." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Danielle add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Danielle add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I hope she'll be a fool -- that's the best thing a girl can be in this world, a beautiful little fool." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Danielle add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Danielle add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "He smiled understandingly-much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it, that you may come across four or five times in life. It faced--or seemed to face--the whole eternal world for an instant, and then concentrated on you with an irresistible prejudice in your favor. It understood you just as far as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you would like to believe in yourself, and assured you that it had precisely the impression of you that, at your best, you hoped to convey." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald
